intro: Tabernaemontana malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It is often found in lowland tropical forests and thrives in humid, warm climates. The bark and leaves of this species have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
